body.ab: <lb n="c57-0092__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0092.02" unit="tei:head"/>Chap <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0092__main__d3e16680"/>11<del eID="c57-0092__main__d3e16680"/> 2.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0092__main__2"/> London was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0092__main__d3e16690"/>the<del eID="c57-0092__main__d3e16690"/> our present point <lb n="c57-0092__main__3"/> of rest; we determined to remain several <lb n="c57-0092__main__4"/> months in this wonderful & celebrated city. <lb n="c57-0092__main__5"/> Cl<mdel>ai</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0092__main__d3e16717"/>wished<del eID="c57-0092__main__d3e16717"/>desired for the intercourse of <lb n="c57-0092__main__6"/> the men of genius & talent who flou<lb n="c57-0092__main__7"/>rished at that time; but this was, with <lb n="c57-0092__main__8"/> me, a secondary <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0092__main__d3e16737"/>consideration<del eID="c57-0092__main__d3e16737"/>object; I was princi<lb n="c57-0092__main__9"/>pally occupied with the means of obtaining <lb n="c57-0092__main__10"/> the information necessary for the comple<lb n="c57-0092__main__11"/>tion of my promise and quickly availed <lb n="c57-0092__main__12"/> myself of the letters of introduction that <lb n="c57-0092__main__13"/> I had brought with me addressed to <lb n="c57-0092__main__14"/> the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0092__main__d3e16767"/>various<del eID="c57-0092__main__d3e16767"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>most<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0092__main__d3e16779"/>men of sci<del eID="c57-0092__main__d3e16779"/> distinguished <lb n="c57-0092__main__15"/> natural philosophers. If this journey had <lb n="c57-0092__main__16"/> taken place during my days of study &<lb n="c57-0092__main__17"/> happiness it would have afforded me <lb n="c57-0092__main__18"/> inexpressible <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0092__main__d3e16792"/>delight<del eID="c57-0092__main__d3e16792"/> pleasure. But a <lb n="c57-0092__main__19"/> blight had come over my existence & I only <lb n="c57-0092__main__20"/> visited these people for the sake of the <lb n="c57-0092__main__21"/> information they might give<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0092__main__d3e16802"/>d<del eID="c57-0092__main__d3e16802"/> me on <lb n="c57-0092__main__22"/> the subject in which I was so deeply <lb n="c57-0092__main__23"/> interrested. Company was ir<mdel/>ksome to me; <lb n="c57-0092__main__24"/> when alone I could fill my mind with the <lb n="c57-0092__main__25"/> sights of heaven & earth; the voice of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0092__main__d3e16825"/>He<del eID="c57-0092__main__d3e16825"/><lb n="c57-0092__main__26"/><lb n="c57-0092__left_margin__1"/>Henry soothed me & I could cheat myself into a<lb n="c57-0092__main__27"/> transitory peace. But busy, uninterresting,<lb n="c57-0092__main__28"/> joyous faces brought back despair to my<lb n="c57-0092__main__29"/> heart. I saw an insurmountable barrie<lb n="c57-0092__main__30"/> placed between me & my fellow men; thi<lb n="c57-0092__main__31"/> barrier was sealed with the blood of<lb n="c57-0092__main__32"/> William and Justine, and to reflect on<lb n="c57-0092__main__33"/> those events filled my soul with anguish<lb n="c57-0092__main__34"/> But in Cl<mdel>ai</mdel>erval I saw the image of my <lb n="c57-0092__main__35"/> former self; he was inquisitive & anxious<lb n="c57-0093__main__1"/> to gain experience & instruction; The <lb n="c57-0093__main__2"/> difference of manners <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0093__main__d3e16903"/>that<del eID="c57-0093__main__d3e16903"/>which he observed <lb n="c57-0093__main__3"/> was to him <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0093__main__d3e16912"/>&<del eID="c57-0093__main__d3e16912"/> an inexhaustible source of <lb n="c57-0093__main__4"/><lb n="c57-0093__left_margin__1"/>observation &amusement. He was for ever busy & the <lb n="c57-0093__main__5"/> only check to his enjoyments was my sor<lb n="c57-0093__main__6"/>rowful& dejected m<mdel>ei</mdel>ien. I tried to conceal <lb n="c57-0093__main__7"/> this as much as possible that I might not <lb n="c57-0093__main__8"/> debar him from the pleasures natural <lb n="c57-0093__main__9"/> to one who was entering on a new scene <lb n="c57-0093__main__10"/> of life, undisturbed by any care or <del rend="smear" sID="c57-0093__main__d3e16955"/>the<del eID="c57-0093__main__d3e16955"/>bitter<lb n="c57-0093__main__11"/><lb n="c57-0093__left_margin__1"/><del rend="smear" sID="c57-0093__left_margin__d3e16971"/>ness of <del eID="c57-0093__left_margin__d3e16971"/>recollection. I often refused to accompany <lb n="c57-0093__main__12"/> him alledging another engagement that <lb n="c57-0093__main__13"/> I might remain a alone; I now also <lb n="c57-0093__main__14"/> began to collect the materials necessary <lb n="c57-0093__main__15"/> for my <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0093__main__d3e16989"/>work<del eID="c57-0093__main__d3e16989"/> new creation & this was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0093__main__d3e16992"/>a<del eID="c57-0093__main__d3e16992"/> to <lb n="c57-0093__main__16"/> me like the torture of single drops of <lb n="c57-0093__main__17"/> water continually falling on the head; <lb n="c57-0093__main__18"/> Every thought that was devoted to it <lb n="c57-0093__main__19"/> was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0093__main__d3e17004"/>th<del eID="c57-0093__main__d3e17004"/> an extreme anguish, and every <lb n="c57-0093__main__20"/> word that I spoke in allusion to it caused <lb n="c57-0093__main__21"/> my lips to quiver & my heart to palpitate.<lb n="c57-0093__main__22"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0093__main__d3e17017"/>in a most painful degre<del eID="c57-0093__main__d3e17017"/><del rend="unmarked" sID="c57-0093__main__d3e17020"/>e.<del eID="c57-0093__main__d3e17020"/><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0093__main__23"/> After passing some months in <lb n="c57-0093__main__24"/> London we received a letter from a <lb n="c57-0093__main__25"/> person in Scotland who had formerly <lb n="c57-0093__main__26"/> been <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0093__main__d3e17034"/>an<del eID="c57-0093__main__d3e17034"/> our visitor at Geneva. He <lb n="c57-0093__main__27"/> mentioned the beauties of his native coun<lb n="c57-0093__main__28"/>try& asked us if those were not sufficient <lb n="c57-0093__main__29"/> allurements to induce us to prolong our <lb n="c57-0093__main__30"/> journey as far <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0093__main__d3e17050"/>noth<del eID="c57-0093__main__d3e17050"/> north as Perth <lb n="c57-0093__main__31"/> where he resided. Cl<mdel>ai</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval eagerly desired <lb n="c57-0093__main__32"/> to accept this invitation, and I, although <lb n="c57-0093__main__33"/> I abhorred society, wished to view again <lb n="c57-0093__main__34"/> mountains & streams & all the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0093__main__d3e17077"/>the<del eID="c57-0093__main__d3e17077"/> wondrous <lb n="c57-0093__main__35"/> works of nature in her chosen dwelling places<lb n="c57-0094__main__1"/> We had arrived in Englan <mdel>in</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>at the beginning <lb n="c57-0094__main__2"/> of October and it was now february; we according<lb n="c57-0094__main__3"/>ly determined to commence our journey <lb n="c57-0094__main__4"/> towards the north at <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0094__main__d3e17118"/>ex<del eID="c57-0094__main__d3e17118"/> at the expiration of <lb n="c57-0094__main__5"/> another month. In this expedition we did <lb n="c57-0094__main__6"/> not intend to follow the great road to Edinburgh <lb n="c57-0094__main__7"/> But to visit Windsor, Oxford, Matlock & the <lb n="c57-0094__main__8"/> Cumberland lakes resolving to arrive at the <lb n="c57-0094__main__9"/> completion of this tour about the end of <lb n="c57-0094__main__10"/> July. I packed my chemical instruments <lb n="c57-0094__main__11"/>& the materials which I had collected resolv<lb n="c57-0094__main__12"/>ing to finish my labours in some obscure <lb n="c57-0094__main__13"/> nook in the country.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0094__main__14"/> We quitted London on the 27 of <lb n="c57-0094__main__15"/> March and remain<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>ed a few days at Windsor <lb n="c57-0094__main__16"/> rambling in its beautiful forest. This was <lb n="c57-0094__main__17"/> a new scene to us mountaineers; The <del next="#c57-0094.02" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0094__main__d3e17168"/>beauti<del eID="c57-0094__main__d3e17168"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>majectic<lb n="c57-0094__main__18"/><del sID="c57-0094__main__d3e17183" xml:id="c57-0094.02"/>ful<del eID="c57-0094__main__d3e17183"/> oaks the quantity of game & the beau<lb n="c57-0094__main__19"/>tiful flocks of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0094__main__d3e17204"/>beautiful<del eID="c57-0094__main__d3e17204"/>lovely deer were all novelties <lb n="c57-0094__main__20"/> to us. From thence we proceeded to Oxford. <lb n="c57-0094__main__21"/> We were charmed with the appearance <lb n="c57-0094__main__22"/> of the town. The colledges are antient and <lb n="c57-0094__main__23"/> picturesque, the streets broard & the lands<lb n="c57-0094__main__24"/>cape rendered perfect by the lovely Isis.<lb n="c57-0094__main__25"/> which <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0094__main__d3e17232"/>near here<del eID="c57-0094__main__d3e17232"/> spreads into broard &<lb n="c57-0094__main__26"/> placid expance of water & runs south <lb n="c57-0094__main__27"/> of the town. We had <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0094__main__d3e17239"/>seve<del eID="c57-0094__main__d3e17239"/> letters to several <lb n="c57-0094__main__28"/> of the professors <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0094__main__d3e17250"/>& were<del eID="c57-0094__main__d3e17250"/>who received <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>us with great <lb n="c57-0094__main__29"/> politeness &<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0094__main__d3e17271"/>cord<del eID="c57-0094__main__d3e17271"/> cordiality. We found that the <lb n="c57-0094__main__30"/> regulations of this university were much <lb n="c57-0094__main__31"/> improved since the days of Gibbon; But <lb n="c57-0094__main__32"/> there is still <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0094__main__d3e17281"/>pr<del eID="c57-0094__main__d3e17281"/> in fashion a great deal <lb n="c57-0094__main__33"/> of bigotry & devotion to established rules that <lb n="c57-0094__main__34"/> constrains the mind of the students & leads <lb n="c57-0094__main__35"/> to slavish & narrow principles of action.<lb n="c57-0095__main__1"/> Many enormities are also practised which <lb n="c57-0095__main__2"/> although they might excite the laughter <lb n="c57-0095__main__3"/> of a stranger were looked upon in the <lb n="c57-0095__main__4"/><lb n="c57-0095__left_margin__1"/>world of the university as matters of the utmost <lb n="c57-0095__main__5"/> consequence. Some of the gentlemen obsti<lb n="c57-0095__main__6"/>nately wore light coloured pantaloons <lb n="c57-0095__main__7"/> when it was the rule of the colledge to <lb n="c57-0095__main__8"/> wear dark: <mdel>T</mdel>the masters were angry <lb n="c57-0095__main__9"/>& their sc<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>holar<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0095__main__d3e17356"/>d<del eID="c57-0095__main__d3e17356"/>s resolute so that while <lb n="c57-0095__main__10"/> we were there<lb n="c57-0095__left_margin__1"/>during our stay two of the students were <lb n="c57-0095__main__11"/> on the point of being expelled on th<mdel>e</mdel>is<lb n="c57-0095__main__12"/> very question. The th<mdel/>reatened severity <lb n="c57-0095__main__13"/> caused a considerable change in the <lb n="c57-0095__main__14"/> costume of the gentlemen for seve<lb n="c57-0095__main__15"/>ral days.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0095__main__16"/> Such, to our infinite astonishment, <lb n="c57-0095__main__17"/> we found to be the principal topic <lb n="c57-0095__main__18"/> of conversation when we arrived in <lb n="c57-0095__main__19"/> the town. Our minds had been filled <lb n="c57-0095__main__20"/> with the remembrance of <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the events that <lb n="c57-0095__main__21"/> had been transacted here above <lb n="c57-0095__main__22"/><lb n="c57-0095__left_margin__1"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0095__left_margin__d3e17451"/>two <del eID="c57-0095__left_margin__d3e17451"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0095__main__d3e17458"/>a<del eID="c57-0095__main__d3e17458"/> centur<mdel>y</mdel><mdel>ie</mdel>ys& a half before. It was here that Charles <lb n="c57-0095__main__23"/> I had collected his forces; this town had <lb n="c57-0095__main__24"/> been faithful to him when the whole <lb n="c57-0095__main__25"/> nation had forsaken him to join the <lb n="c57-0095__main__26"/> standard of parliament & liberty. <lb n="c57-0095__main__27"/> It was strange to us <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>as we enter<del rend="overwritten" sID="c57-0095__main__d3e17507"/>ing<del eID="c57-0095__main__d3e17507"/>ed in the town <lb n="c57-0095__main__28"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0095__main__d3e17517"/>full of the<del eID="c57-0095__main__d3e17517"/> our thoughts <mdel>co</mdel>were occupied <lb n="c57-0095__main__29"/> by the memory th<mdel>a</mdel>e<mdel>t</mdel> unfortunate king, <lb n="c57-0095__main__30"/> the amiable Falkland and the insolent <lb n="c57-0095__main__31"/> Gower <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0095__main__d3e17550"/>and finding<del eID="c57-0095__main__d3e17550"/>but we found it filled with <lb n="c57-0095__main__32"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0095__main__d3e17559"/>gown<del eID="c57-0095__main__d3e17559"/> gownsmen & students who think <lb n="c57-0095__main__33"/> of nothing less than these events. Yet <lb n="c57-0095__main__34"/> there are some relics to remind you <lb n="c57-0095__main__35"/> of antient times; Among others we regarded<lb n="c57-0096__main__1"/> with curiosity the press instituted by the author <lb n="c57-0096__main__2"/> of the history <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>of the troubles We <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0096__main__d3e17593"/>we<del eID="c57-0096__main__d3e17593"/>re also shewn a roo<mdel>n</mdel>m<lb n="c57-0096__main__3"/> which <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0096__main__d3e17610"/>the<del eID="c57-0096__main__d3e17610"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0096__main__d3e17613"/>Lord Chancellor<del eID="c57-0096__main__d3e17613"/>Frier Bacon <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the disoverer of gunpowder had <lb n="c57-0096__main__4"/> inhabited and which, as it was predicted, <lb n="c57-0096__main__5"/> would fall in when a man wiser than <lb n="c57-0096__main__6"/> that philosopher should enter it.<note resp="#pbs"/>no sweet Pecksie–'twas fr Bacon the discoverer of gunpowder. A <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a short, round faced pratingprofes<lb n="c57-0096__main__7"/>sor who accompanied us<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0096__main__d3e17663"/>e<del eID="c57-0096__main__d3e17663"/> refused to pass <lb n="c57-0096__main__8"/> the threshold; although we ventured inside <lb n="c57-0096__main__9"/> in perfect <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0096__main__d3e17671"/>safety<del eID="c57-0096__main__d3e17671"/>. security <lb n="c57-0096__left_margin__1"/> and probably <lb n="c57-0096__left_margin__2"/> he might <lb n="c57-0096__left_margin__3"/> have done the same<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0096__main__10"/> Matlock, which was our next <lb n="c57-0096__main__11"/> place of rest, resembled to a great<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0096__main__d3e17696"/>er<del eID="c57-0096__main__d3e17696"/> degree <lb n="c57-0096__main__12"/> the scenery of Switzerland; But every thing <lb n="c57-0096__main__13"/> is on a lower scale & the green <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0096__main__d3e17705"/>mountains<del eID="c57-0096__main__d3e17705"/>hills<lb n="c57-0096__main__14"/> want the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0096__main__d3e17717"/>cwon<del eID="c57-0096__main__d3e17717"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>crown of distant white alps <lb n="c57-0096__main__15"/> which always attend on the piny <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0096__main__d3e17732"/>hills<del eID="c57-0096__main__d3e17732"/><lb n="c57-0096__main__16"/> of our country. We visited <lb n="c57-0096__main__17"/> the wondrous cave & the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0096__main__d3e17751"/>the<del eID="c57-0096__main__d3e17751"/> little cabinets <lb n="c57-0096__main__18"/> of natural history where the curiosities <lb n="c57-0096__main__19"/> are disposed in the same manner <lb n="c57-0096__main__20"/> as in the collections at Servox &Chamou<lb n="c57-0096__main__21"/>nix. The latter mame made me tremble <lb n="c57-0096__main__22"/> when pronounced by Henry & I hastened <lb n="c57-0096__main__23"/> to quit Matlock where the scenes were <lb n="c57-0096__main__24"/> thus as<mdel>ss</mdel>cociated.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0096__main__25"/> From Derby, still journeying north<lb n="c57-0096__main__26"/>ward, we passed two months among the <lb n="c57-0096__main__27"/> mountains of<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>in Cumberland & Westmorland. <lb n="c57-0096__main__28"/> I could now almost fancy myself among <lb n="c57-0096__main__29"/> the Swiss mountains; The little patches of <lb n="c57-0096__main__30"/> snow which yet lingered <mdel>i</mdel>on the northern<lb n="c57-0096__main__31"/> sides of the mountains – the lakes & the <lb n="c57-0096__main__32"/> dashing of the rocky <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0096__main__d3e17838"/>mountain<del eID="c57-0096__main__d3e17838"/> streams <lb n="c57-0096__main__33"/> were all <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0096__main__d3e17843"/>dear<del eID="c57-0096__main__d3e17843"/> familiar & dear sights <lb n="c57-0096__main__34"/>to me. Here also we made some aquain<lb n="c57-0097__main__1"/>tances who almost contrived to cheat <lb n="c57-0097__main__2"/> me into happiness. The delight of <lb n="c57-0097__main__3"/> Cl<mdel>ai</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval was proportionably greater <lb n="c57-0097__main__4"/> than mine; his mind expanded in <lb n="c57-0097__main__5"/> the company of men of talent & he found <lb n="c57-0097__main__6"/> in himself greater capacity & feeling <lb n="c57-0097__main__7"/> than he could ^have imagined himself to <lb n="c57-0097__main__8"/> have possessed while he associated <lb n="c57-0097__main__9"/> with his inferiors. "I could pass my life <lb n="c57-0097__main__10"/> here," said he to me, "and among these <lb n="c57-0097__main__11"/> mountains I should hardly regret <lb n="c57-0097__main__12"/> Switzerland & the Rhine.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0097__main__13"/> But he found that a travellers <lb n="c57-0097__main__14"/> life is <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0097__main__d3e17921"/>that<del eID="c57-0097__main__d3e17921"/> one that includes much <lb n="c57-0097__main__15"/> pain amidst its enjoyments. His feelings <lb n="c57-0097__main__16"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0097__main__d3e17930"/>were<del eID="c57-0097__main__d3e17930"/>are for ever on the strectch & when <lb n="c57-0097__main__17"/> he beg<mdel>a</mdel>ins to sink into repose he <lb n="c57-0097__main__18"/> f<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0097__main__d3e17956"/>ound<del eID="c57-0097__main__d3e17956"/>inds himself obliged <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>to quit it for something <lb n="c57-0097__main__19"/> new which again engage<mdel>d</mdel>s his atten<lb n="c57-0097__main__20"/>tion& which <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0097__main__d3e17993"/>he<del eID="c57-0097__main__d3e17993"/> also he fors<mdel>oo</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>akes for <lb n="c57-0097__main__21"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0097__main__d3e18019"/>more<del eID="c57-0097__main__d3e18019"/><lb n="c57-0097__left_margin__1"/>other novelt<mdel>y</mdel>ies. We had scarcely visited <lb n="c57-0097__main__22"/> the various lakes of Cumberland &<lb n="c57-0097__main__23"/> Westmorland & conceived an affection <lb n="c57-0097__main__24"/> for some of the inhabitants when the <lb n="c57-0097__main__25"/> period of our appointment with our <lb n="c57-0097__main__26"/> Scotch friend approached & we left the<mdel>n</mdel>m<lb n="c57-0097__main__27"/> to travel on. For my own part I was <lb n="c57-0097__main__28"/> not sorry. I had now neglected my promise <lb n="c57-0097__main__29"/> for some time and I feared the effects <lb n="c57-0097__main__30"/> of the dæmons disappointment. He <lb n="c57-0097__main__31"/> might remain in Switzerland & wreack <lb n="c57-0097__main__32"/> his vengeance of my relati<del rend="overwritten" sID="c57-0097__main__d3e18077"/>ons<del eID="c57-0097__main__d3e18077"/>ves; this idea <lb n="c57-0097__main__33"/> persued me & tormented me at every <lb n="c57-0097__main__34"/> moment when I might otherwise have <lb n="c57-0097__main__35"/> snatched repose & peace.
